Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to multi-task with a flexible approach to working are a must. Some weekend work may be required.Please note, candidates must be able to work in the UK independently, as we are not able to offer visa sponsorship.This role would be ideal for someone looking for career progression in the veterinary industry in a nurturing and fun environment. General duties include: *Provision of physiotherapy to patients within the hospital and on an out-patient basis.*Liaison with clinicians, veterinary nurses, and owners to ensure a coherent patient care plan.*Contribution to the implementation and validation of clinical quality assurance measures.*Communication and provision of advice to owners of patients, including emotional support.*Responsibility for ensuring equipment within the area of specialism is maintained and for sourcing new equipment when required.*Ensuring that all patients treatments are charged and paid for at the time. *Participation in the out-patient clinic and maintaining patient records, ensuring that all documents are completed.*Assisting with data collection for gait analysis, teaching and research purposes. Work with cutting-edge facilities Situated just outside of High Wycombe (J4, M40), Buckinghamshire, Hamilton Specialist Referrals (HSR) is a purpose-built, state of the art veterinary hospital that provides the latest in specialist treatments for cats and dogs, supported by an exceptional rehabilitation and physiotherapy facility. The hospital is operational 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, and can offer the most advanced treatment options available for Orthopaedic, Neurology, Soft Tissue, Oncology, and Internal Medicine cases. There is a 1.5T high-field magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and computerised tomography (CT) suite on-site, and the hospital has invested in the latest direct digital radiography systems (also known as radiographs or X-rays) (DR). We routinely use computerised gait analysis to aid in the diagnosis of complex multi-limb lameness and employ the same technology to monitor recovery from surgery. This individual approach to post-operative rehabilitation optimises outcomes and shortens recovery times. Despite working within such a large team, we pride ourselves on maintaining a friendly and supportive culture with a focus on development, clinical excellence, and gold standard patient care.  We recently opened a state of the art HDU unit, a remarkable addition that significantly elevates the level of care and support we can offer to our valued patients. This exciting enhancement is a testament to our steadfast commitment to our patients wellbeing and recovery. With cutting edge technology and a compassionate approach, we're setting new standards in patient care excellence.  A Collaborative Environment  Be part of a supportive and collaborative team where your contributions are valued. Our clinic fosters an environment of continuous learning and professional growth, ensuring that you thrive both personally and as a vital member of our veterinary family. We have a dedicated team of over 100 people, including 11 specialists, 2 residents, 26 RVNs and various support teams.
